text: {{Infobox writer |name = Truman Capote |image = Truman Capote by Jack Mitchell.jpg |caption = Truman Capote, 1980 |birth_name = Truman Streckfus Persons |birth_date = |birth_place = New Orleans, Louisiana, United States |death_date = |death_place = Los Angeles, California, United States |resting_place = Westwood Memorial Park, Los Angeles |partner = Jack Dunphy |occupation = Artist, novelist, short story writer, screenwriter, playwright |movement = Southern Gothic |period = 1943–1984 |notableworks = In Cold Blood, Breakfast at Tiffany's (novella) |signature = Truman Capote signature.svg }} Truman Capote (born Truman Streckfus Persons, September 30, 1924 – August 25, 1984) was an American author. He was born in New Orleans, LouisianaTCM and grew up in Monroeville, Alabama, New York City and Greenwich, Connecticut. He is best known for writing the half-true novel, In Cold Blood. The novel is based on a murder that happened in Kansas in the 1950s. He became good friends with the man accused of the murder. Capote was openly gay.
